snippet: In less than a year, journalists at every major television news station in the Bay Area have been robbed of expensive cameras, sometimes at gunpoint, and it is changing the way they report.
abstract: Journalists covering crime and other stories in Oakland, Calif, have been repeatedly robbed of expensive cameras over past year; spate has caused a shift in journalistic practices, including use of armed guards and a reluctance to cover stories at night.
lead_paragraph: In less than a year, journalists at every major television news station in the Bay Area have been robbed of expensive cameras, sometimes at gunpoint, and it is changing the way they report.

headline.seo: Photojournalists in Oakland Face Epidemic of Camera Robberies
headline.main: In Oakland, Photojournalists Covering Crimes Become the Victims
headline.print_headline: In Oakland, Photojournalists Covering Crimes Become the Victims
